      • toString

        @Contract(value="null -> null")
 @Nullable
public @Nullable String toString(@Nullable
                                                                              @Nullable String delimiter)
        Parse message to string. Multiple lines are separated by given delimiter, or default.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - Delimiter to divide lines by.
        Returns:
        Parsed String or null if delimiter is null.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Parse message to string.

        Equivalent to toString(String) passed ("\n").

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • sendTo

        public void sendTo(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

      • send

        public void send(@NotNull
                 @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Add Player to Placeholders Context and send him this Message.

        Parses attached Placeholders and colors using color() before sending.

        Parameters:
        player - Player to send this message to.
        See Also:
        Placeholders, Context, Player

      • send

        public void send(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                 Object... context)

      • send

        public void send(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                 Context context)

      • send

        public void send(@Nullable
                 @Nullable org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
        Send this message to CommandSender.

        Parses attached Placeholders and colors using color() before sending.

        Doesn't proceed to send the message if isEmpty() returns true or sender is null.

        Parameters:
        sender - CommandSender to send this message to.

      • sendPrefixed

        public void sendPrefixed(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
        Deprecated. Will be removed upon 4.x release as it is essentially useless. Use LanguageManager.getPrefixed(String) to send a prefixed message properly.
        Send a message starting with %prefix%. Note: Requires Message to be parsed using global placeholders.
        Parameters:
        sender - CommandSender to send to
        See Also:
        LanguageManager.getPrefixed(String), LanguageManager.send(CommandSender, String)
